The BC International Graduate PNP stream is one of British Columbia’s Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP) designed for international students that hold a degree or diploma from a Canadian college or university.

This stream also operates with the Express Entry system. Applicants who are nominated under the Express Entry BC International Graduate stream are eligible to receive extra points on their application when they apply for permanent resident status through one of the Federal immigration programs.

  • Applicants must possess a degree or diploma from a Canadian college or university. They must have obtained this education credential within the last three years.
  • Prospective candidates should note that they cannot apply for this program if the diplomas or certificates they received were from private British Columbia institutions.
  • Foreign students who have gained their education credentials through distance education programs cannot use them for this immigration application.
  • Qualifying programs must also be a minimum of eight months in duration. This excludes time spent at internships and co-op work terms.
